explanations.machine learning: The paper proposes a stock portfolio selection strategy based on machine learning techniques, specifically deep learning and neural networks.
explanations.unsupervised learning: The paper uses clustering algorithms to group similar stocks, which is an unsupervised learning technique.
explanations.clustering: The paper applies clustering algorithms on learned vector representations to group similar stocks.
explanations.feature representation: The paper transforms multi-dimensional time series data into a learned vector space, which involves feature representation.
explanations.neural network: The paper uses both deep and shallow neural networks in its proposed strategy.
explanations.deep learning: The paper employs a deep LSTM Autoencoder to learn vector representations, which is a deep learning technique.
explanations.representation learning: The paper focuses on learning vector representations of time series data, which is a form of representation learning.
explanations.long short-term memory: The paper uses a deep LSTM Autoencoder to learn the vector representations of the time series.
explanations.LSTM: The paper uses LSTM (Long Short-Term Memory) networks as part of its deep learning approach.
explanations.autoencoder: The paper employs an LSTM Autoencoder to learn the vector representations of the time series data.
